description: Two different numbers a, b which satisfy sigma(a)=sigma(b)=(a+b)^3/(a^2+b^2) are called a rational amicable pair; sequence gives b numbers.
comments: These are just the known values. There is no proof that this sequence is correct (in the usual sense that there are no other terms below the last term shown). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 07 2006Factorization: 2^(n-1)*M(n)*3*5^2*13*31*139*277*3877*239 where M(n) is Mersenne Prime, n=3 or 5<n.
links: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Rational Amicable Pair.
author: _Yasutoshi Kohmoto_
